objectives: Use clear transitions to move between scenes in a story
Anchor time and space markers to signal scene changes

vocab.def: Shift between scenes; marked with pause + time/place.
Anchor showing where the action happens (SCHOOL, HOME, PARK).
Short break with eye contact reset to show new scene.
Body/gaze move to indicate scene change.

sections.heading: 1. Why Transitions Matter
sections.body: Without clear transitions, stories feel jumbled. ASL storytellers mark scenes with **pause, time/place anchors, and shifts in body orientation**.

sections.heading: 2. Model: Simple Two-Scene Story

media.alt: Narrator shifts from school to home
media.caption: Scene 1: SCHOOL. Scene 2: HOME. Transition with PAUSE + TIME + SHIFT.

sections.body: Watch: **YESTERDAY SCHOOL, CLASS FINISH. (pause, gaze reset) LATER HOME, FAMILY EAT.**

sections.heading: 3. Drill: Time + Place Reset
sections.body: Practice chaining: **MORNING SCHOOLâ€¦ AFTERNOON PARKâ€¦ EVENING HOME.** Insert small pause + gaze reset each time.

microCheck.q: What makes a scene change clearest?

sections.teacherNote: Look for pauses, resets, and consistent anchors.
